message.content:
cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.LG

This paper proposes a new algorithm for V2V communications in vehicular networks, which involves the exchange of information between vehicles and infrastructure nodes. This topic is closely related to the field of networked systems and communication, which falls under the category of cs.NI (Networks and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper proposes a context-aware algorithm that allows vehicles to dynamically select their communication technology based on their application requirements and communication context conditions. This aspect of the paper involves the use of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, which could place it under the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The paper also deals with the issue of scalability and bandwidth requirements, which could place it under the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. The use of communication technology and the optimization of network capacity could also place the paper under the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a distributed and decentralized algorithm, which could involve the use of machine learning (ML) techniques, placing it under the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
